data.title: Rumor - Lion King Flume Ride being considered for Animal Kingdom
data.meta_description:
Just to confirm please, the excitement is the ride add to AK, not the restaurant add to Destiny?

Insiders??

No excitement here, only mourning.
data.meta_site_name: WDWMAGIC - Unofficial Walt Disney World discussion forums
data.text:
No excitement here, only mourning.

Do you have a desperate need to misrepresent people expressing preferences with regard to attraction content? There is no mass wailing and gnashing of teeth. Most people in the thread agree on wanting new things built and will probably move on and still enjoy the parks even if the added attractions don‚Äôt exactly meet their hopes and expectations. But before a formal announcement, people are going to discuss what direction they would prefer. It‚Äôs not a big deal.

Do you have a desperate need to misrepresent people expressing preferences with regard to attraction content? There is no mass wailing and gnashing of teeth. Most people in the thread agree on wanting new things built and will probably move on and still enjoy the parks even if the added attractions don‚Äôt exactly meet their hopes and expectations. But before a formal announcement, people are going to discuss what direction they would prefer. It‚Äôs not a big deal.

lol chill. Obviously it‚Äôs not just mourning here

Just to confirm please, the excitement is the ride add to AK, not the restaurant add to Destiny?

Insiders??

The lion logo is next to the Tree of Life on the D23 poster, not DCL.

The lion logo is next to the Tree of Life on the D23 poster, not DCL.

Honestly, I was under the impression that the Lion King addition to DAK was far off from an announcement, but given this little detail in the D23 poster, am I wrong to assume this? I assumed Paris was going to be announced first, definitely didn't think both at the same event. I welcome it, regardless.

Honestly, I was under the impression that the Lion King addition to DAK was far off from an announcement, but given this little detail in the D23 poster, am I wrong to assume this? I assumed Paris was going to be announced first, definitely didn't think both at the same event. I welcome it, regardless.

Wondering if it could be a new nighttime show vs. a ride. No insider info here though, just speculating.

Not that I‚Äôd want an attraction to be based on the Live action version but I saw Jungle Book for the first time in a few years last night. Forgot how good it is. One of the only live action remakes I enjoyed.

Not that I‚Äôd want an attraction to be based on the Live action version but I saw Jungle Book for the first time in a few years last night. Forgot how good it is. One of the only live action remakes I enjoyed.

A Jungle Book attraction is long overdue. Aladdin too (Cave of Wonders anyone?) but that's a different discussion/park. Shame they let Kali River limp along. I guess it gets adequate GSATs though. Wouldn't hurt my feeling any to see it get the IP mandate treatment. A Jungle Book rapids ride in an Animal-themed amusement park? Crazy, right?

A Jungle Book attraction is overdue. Aladdin too (Cave of Wonders anyone?) but that's a different discussion/park. Shame they let Kali River Rapids limp along. I guess it gets adequate GSATs though. Wouldn't hurt my feeling any to see it get the IP mandate treatment. A Jungle Book rapids ride in an Animal-themed park?

Aladdin and Jungle Book are at the very top of the list. Followed by Mary Poppins!

Not that I‚Äôd want an attraction to be based on the Live action version but I saw Jungle Book for the first time in a few years last night. Forgot how good it is. One of the only live action remakes I enjoyed.

Jungle Book is IMHO the only live action remake that surpasses the quality of the original. If they ever would bring Jungle Book into DAK - and I think they should! - I'd favor using the live action version as the basis.

Jungle Book is IMHO the only live action remake that surpasses the quality of the original. If they ever would bring Jungle Book into DAK - and I think they should! - I'd favor using the live action version as the basis.

I agree that the live action movie is better but still the think the ride should be based on the animated version. The characters are more charming and the versions of the songs are more iconic. Overall, the animated version has everything you need to make a good ride. Besides, Jungle Cruise kind of has the live action animals thing covered.

How to tell if someone has never faced a challenge in their life.

I know this doesn't really apply, but it was an excuse to get a Lion King gif in here.

I agree that the live action movie is better but still the think the ride should be based on the animated version. The characters are more charming and the versions of the songs are more iconic. Overall, the animated version has everything you need to make a good ride. Besides, Jungle Cruise kind of has the live action animals thing covered.

Plus, the animated one's been begging for an attraction for a while.

The Jungle Book has a more outright connection to man and nature than The Lion King, it's why both the stories and film stood the test of time. It's just a timeless story on how man and nature interact that fits into DAK cleaner than Lion Hamlet.

Ya know if the Lion King flume ride is guranteed.. there‚Äôs always the possibility, if they wanted to.. they could make the Festival show Jungle Book to balance things out/add more variety Otherwise, I def think Jungle Book being the ride and then keeping the Festival of the Lion King works out best. But truthfully, either way is fine IMO.

Ya know if the Lion King flume ride is guranteed.. there‚Äôs always the possibility, if they wanted to.. they could make the Festival show Jungle Book to balance things out/add more variety Otherwise, I def think Jungle Book being the ride and then keeping the Festival of the Lion King works out best. But truthfully, either way is fine IMO.

I‚Äôd hope not. A Jungle Book show makes no sense in Harambe. Unless they were to move the theater a second time, which isn‚Äôt going to happen

Curious, if Lion King land for DLP is announced, but Lion King isn't announced for Animal Kingdom, how likely is it that the rumors for a Lion King Ride for AK was just confused with rumors for DLP's Lion King land??

P.S., today is National Lion Day, so as appropriate day to announced a Lion King attraction
